pullRequest.body:
+ Extract from `Lifts.exists_lift_of_splits` a version that assumes integrality and splitting of minimal polynomial over an intermediate field (either actual IntermediateField or middle of IsScalarTower) rather than the base field

+ Generalize `exists_algHom_adjoin_of_splits`, `exists_algHom_of_adjoin_splits`, `exists_algHom_of_splits` to the same setting

+ Prove the [extension lemma](https://math.stackexchange.com/a/687914/12932) `surjective_comp_algebraMap_of_isAlgebraic/isSeparable` to be used in the proof that an epimorphism in the category of fields is a purely inseparable extension.

---

nodes.body: :v: alreadydone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7479723997/job/20357525948)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7479723997/job/20357524764)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7479723997/job/20357525094)
Perhaps the docstrings should be changed? The old `Lifts.exists_lift_of_splits` is "whose conjugates over `F` are all in `K`", and the new one is "whose conjugates over `x.carrier` are all in `K`".
Thanks! This was an oversight. I shouldn't have modified the copy of the theorem that carries the docstring with it ...
Can you add a docstring to this one (and to the other version)? Maybe also a reference, for example is this Lemma 4.13 of http://alpha.math.uga.edu/~pete/FieldTheory.pdf ?

```suggestion
/-- If E/L/K is a tower of field extensions with E/L algebraic, and if M is an algebraically
  closed extension of K, then any embedding of L/K into M/K extends to an embedding of E/K.
  Known as the extension lemma in https://math.stackexchange.com/a/687914. -/
theorem surjective_comp_algebraMap_of_isAlgebraic {E : Type*}
```
I'm adding the StackExchange link; web link can be more robust than lemma numbers in a PDF which are subject to updates, and 4.13 isn't an exact match. I'm not sure whether this version that allows L/K to be transcendental is written down anywhere other than the answer.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (FieldTheory/Adjoin): generalize `IntermediateField.exists_algHom_of_splits`
